content.text:
Also: the world is "donut-shaped" because the top and bottom of the map are stitched together *and* the left and right sides of the map are stitched together. This forms a [torus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torus), which actually seems sort of interesting? I skimmed a [worldbuilding video about donut planets](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1J4iIBKJHLA) and it sounds like they might have some interesting climate, geography, and even gravity (!), which could be fun to generate and simulate.
